conclusion: To determine the state of the elevator at t=4.5s, analyze the acceleration graph.
The graph shows acceleration (a) in m/s^2 as a function of time (t) in seconds.
At t=4.5s, the graph shows the acceleration is just below 2 m/s^2.
Positive acceleration indicates the elevator is accelerating upwards.
When an object accelerates upwards, it experiences an upward force greater than its weight, leading to a feeling of increased weight or overload.
Since the acceleration is positive at t=4.5s, the elevator is experiencing an upward force greater than its weight.
This condition is known as overload.
At t=4.5s, the elevator is in a state of overload.
